page.title: 17VILLAGE SURVEY
page.content: A survey was carried out by Englefield Primary School which found that most households had televisions and radios and in their kitchens they had cookers,'fridges and washing machines. A large number had freezers which could be used to freeze vegetables grown in the sizeable gardens the majority of houses have. Most households owned a car. Those who relied on the bus service on the main road found it inadequate. Clubs and sports played a fairly large part in Englefield. There is a popular social club, a football and a cricket club, both of which have grounds. Villagers are able to use the Benyon's swimming pool in the Summer. A recent growth in Church activities, such as the Mother's Union, has increased membership. Some went regularly, others only on special occasions.
